review_title: Amazing work culture, decent engineering and okay employee management
pros: - Spectacular flexibility in the work culture - Great ownership opportunities - Quality of engineering team is 75% - HR team is good at administrative tasks
cons: - Diversity is inclined towards Chinese, HK, SG - No annual company meetups - CEO & Upper management is more into results than for employees - No proper review feedback process between managers and direct reporter

review_title: Management dishonest, hire and fire culture
pros: Flexible working style, can work from home
cons:
-Management lacks transparency. They're not open and treat employees are just treated as a number.
-Management has lack of foresight. In mid 2022 they hired lots of people, only to lay them off 1 month later. You would think they would have learnt but they repeated the same thing towards the end of 2022, hiring numerous people only to lay them off soon after. 
-Ceo is dishonest, lies about layoff figures.1st round of layoff is not 5% but closer to 40%. the latest round of layoff is mentioned as 20% but is probably closer to 50%. Also paints a good picture internally but proceeds to lay people off suddenly with no tact, just an email from HR to personal acct and people realizing they got locked out. 
-The salary is pretty poor, considering that the bonus and rsu vest in small amount in the 1st year. A lot of people did not manage to get bonus or rsu either since they got laid off. 
-Would not recommend anyone to work here as management has a total lack of regard for employees. Its really sad that a lot of capable people got burnt, rejecting good offers and leaving their comfy tech jobs only to get laid off due to poor & inconsiderate decision making.
 -The company spends a lot on marketing. Sadly, similar to its marketing, it tries to look expensive outside but lacks the quality to back it up internally.

pros: Good culture and good WLB
cons: CRO dropped a lot after joining

review_title: Flexible global company which allowed you to work remotely everyday
pros: The Pros are heavily depend on your team and department. If most of your team member and reporting managers are working at oversea such as HK, Shenzen, Taiwan, then you can enjoy the perks like flexible working hours, working remotely, manage your own schedule such as lunch time, etc.
cons: As it is crypto winter + incoming recession, the company should be able to sustain by managing resource carefully but please do not expect there will be huge salary increment. Employee retention will be a huge challenge during this bear market.

review_title: Poor leadership and lack of transparency with intentions to hide
pros:
- Work from home policy 
- Nice colleagues
cons:
- Management does not communicate intentions and paint a rosy picture

- Finance team was cut from 90+ to 60ish people, in an extremely quiet laid off, which is inconsistent with what is protrayed in the media

- Alot of finance systems & processes are not updated in a good state and unable to support the current growth and scale operations - by laying off so many finance staff, essentially means that in the next market upcycle, teams would not be able to keep up with the volume

- Not transparent with dubious intentions of hiding information especially surrounding layoffs. Before the layoffs occurs, there was a HR portal which we could see the staff directory, but they remove that so that people won't be able to know how many staff were laid off

pros: remote working do spend and user online tool services for work productivity
cons: too many departments/teams which hinders productivity sometimes the salary package is not that competitive annual payout is not honest. read the contract carefully.

review_title: Good potential but many internal problems
pros: Successful. Interesting crypto plans and projects. Growth potential. Ambitious. Ok starting salary. Strong brand. Remote working. Some teams are good. Many nice people especially junior to mid rank. Made good friends.
cons: Start up culture. Stressful and constant changes.  Some teams very overstaffed but some important teams very understaffed. No management transparency and very secret top-down management style. Management decisions only informed to chosen team heads . Management hide behind chosen heads only and dont know or care who are the real key employees. Some heads are very famous for lacking competency and experience but somehow promoted to senior because joined early , interest in crypto or good talker.  Unclear work scope and overlap between teams.  Politics between teams because no structure. Famous 90 day email record policy, everyone knows this is so obviously ridiculous and wont happen in any other company. Financial decisions dont make sense, even customers complain about this. Spend millions for marketing, deals and try to add rockstars but no care to existing employees,. Management good at lip service answering questions for employees in big meetings but no actions. No automatic compensation or promotion reviews. Limited career chances unless early joiner. No one knows where are the shares in the employees share plan, even asked HR when leaving but they have no idea about anything.

review_title: Join at your own risk. Ceo is one of the most hostile I have met
pros: Direct supervisor is good, branded name
cons: Poor management, you are just a number in this cyclical industry. Extremely poor decision making. I foresee them unable to attract talents in the next bullrun.

Pay and benefits are good

1. Decisions get made from someone/team and conveyed down, with little context or reasoning
2. Middle management with poor leadership skills and questionable capabilities

Personal Issue: My boss is a micromanager where everything is urgent and assigns micro-tasks throughout the day expecting them to be completed immediately. Luck of the draw I suppose.

review_title: Insightful Experience with Fast-Growing Cryptocurrency Company
pros: Opportunity to gain valuable experience in the fast-growing field of cryptocurrency. Chance to work for a well-known and established company in the industry, which could lead to future job opportunities. Exposure to different aspects of the business, which could provide insight into potential areas of interest for future career development. Possibility of learning and developing new skills, such as data analysis and compliance management. Competitive salary and benefits package, including health insurance, retirement plans, and paid time off.
cons: Limited growth potential in the role of a junior KYC analyst, which could lead to feelings of stagnation and lack of fulfillment. High workload and fast-paced environment, which could be stressful for someone without previous experience. Risk of burnout due to long hours and intense focus on detail-oriented tasks. Limited exposure to other areas of the business, which could limit opportunities for cross-functional learning and development. Possibility of being overworked and underappreciated, which could negatively impact job satisfaction.

pros:
Remote work
Crypto.com visa card - can be added to the cons - it's useless now
With small exceptions most of the colleagues were nice and really helpful
cons:
The Bulgarian branch of the company had massive layoffs. However, the figures shared by the CEO regarding the layoffs are inaccurate and do not reflect the true extent of the downsizing with thousand of people losing their jobs. 

The competence of the management team responsible for overseeing the downsizing process. 

The way in which the layoffs were conducted and communicated to affected employees - poorly planned and executed. 

No transparency and integrity of the company's leadership. Many employees were left demotivated and disillusioned with the company's leadership, and this could have a negative impact on the company's overall performance and reputation.

Employees' worth and contributions are not acknowledged or appreciated.

review_title: Poor management and leadership. Quantity over quality.
job_title: Legal Counsel in New York, NY
pros: Aggressively pursuing licences everywhere for expansion. Willing to spend excessive money on high profile partnerships, influencers and marketing, so big brand in the industry. Fully remote work. Starting salary is decent. Lots of nice people especially at junior to mid levels.
cons: As numerous others already posted, there are serious problems with management and leadership. Unfortunately, this will not change as they own the business. According to public media news they were friends before they started crypto.com during previous failed businesses. Management keep trying to persuade everyone that the business is successful and stable by constantly quoting facts and figures in their favour. One example is saying how many millions of users there are on the platform, but not providing any transparency or actual details. It is widely believed that a significant number of users merely opened an account with the business using a minimal deposit and are not actually active. There is sole focus on quantity across all aspects of the business. Productivity is assessed by how many tasks you seem to have finished, and not the standard of work or time taken. There is a real lack of quality due to incompetent management, bad hiring/promoting and lack of internal structure. In Legal, for example, many colleagues believe the team is headed by an incompetent and inexperienced bully who was only promoted due to being the first to join. This causes the whole team to suffer and creates a stressful toxic environment. Many colleagues started to leave and those remaining are also planning an exit. Most decisions are driven in APAC by leaders who have no international experience outside of their own country. Do not believe the numerous fake short positive reviews trying to mask the real negative views of most employees.

job_title: Customer Experience Associate in Sofia, Sofia (city)
pros: -For the region (Bulgaria) the salary is very competitive -Remote work is great
cons: - Working hours can be terrible starting from 6AM until 1AM on shifts with options for night shifts as well. -Major layoffs are common thing -Company internal communications are struggling -Noticable reduction in additional benefits since I started -Very limited development opportunities

review_title: Great design team but bad senior management
pros: You work with great and talented designers who are passionate about their work. Designers are friendly and helpful. 100% work remote is also a plus.
cons: Upper management constantly changes the roadmaps and asks to create last-minute secret projects. Also, the company doesn't put in any effort to engage the employees and treats them as a number only.

pros: Most of HR was surprisingly supportive. Lots of interesting people to with with Yearly bonuses were a great treat Got to lear a lot
cons: Some people with no experience were given leading roles that caused pitfalls in some teams. Not that interested in employees or keeping them on staff

pros: * Remote work * Salary is paid on time * Before 3-4 rounds of big secret terminations, lots of talented people * Company invests in big expensive marketing
cons: * Huge management red flags. There is lots of negative public news about management even before starting Crypto.com. Some leaders are incompetent, but seemed to be promoted because they joined early or just follow orders from management without asking question. Lots of common complaints like delegating work, micromanagement, high turnover, panicking style, promoting friends, secret decision making, being incompetent but taking all credits. Be aware - do not join the HR, Trading or Legal teams. * Many red flags. Finances badly managed. No internal structure. Excessive over hiring, then thousands of secret layoffs because no proper planning. Management lied about numbers. Lots of money for marketing and it's not clear where the money comes from. No leadership transparency. Staff are promised shares and CROs - read the letters very carefully - not even HR could explain to me how the employee share scheme works. * Many talented people terminated or resigned in last 6 months. Turnover in some teams very high. Many remaining are waiting to leave. No people culture. Morale is very low and worry is it will be next FTX. Constant bad media news such as security breaches, management past, sending money to wrong people, cancelled deals, cancelled auditor and banned commercial adverts. Management is focused on increasing revenue but have no idea how to build company infrastructure or manage finances. Very suspicious behaviour, like secretly moving to Japan to live. Card benefits gone. There is no trust in the company. Many colleagues even withdraw their crypto to cold wallet in case the company collapse. The company is rolling downhill fast. Do not join.

pros: In this project, I was responsible for the new project build, refactoring of core modules, and technology discussion. This included business model design, migrating from vue2 to vue3, and implementation of unit testing and e2e testing. After the project was migrated from vue2 to vue3, and the original business code was optimized, the group's development efficiency increased by 30%, and automated unit testing, api testing and end-to-end testing were added to improve the efficiency and accuracy of self-testing to a certain extent.
cons: impersonal and not very sensible

review_title: Avoid the London DeFi Wallet Engineering Roles at All Costs! (It will ruin your engineering career)
pros: - Probably being paid for doing nothing much at work.
cons:
1) Communication barriers. ( I was assigned to the development team based in Shenzhen even though I was hired as a London employee. All the team members can't speak English and only speak Mandarin in all the meetings)


2) 0 flexibility to change teams. (Due to the bear market, the company is freezing hiring and laying off engineers, which means I will be stuck in the current team for a long time with another London-based English-speaking engineer).


3) Terrible code quality (There isn't a single unit test in a whole monolithic repository that's handling the DeFi backend logic. I won't be confident in using the buggy DeFi wallet app that's handling crypto money)


4) Always out of the loop due to the time difference. Hard for me to attend the standup meetings as the Shenzhen team members have standups at 3am GMT every day.


5) No learning opportunities. All the knowledge-sharing sessions are conducted in Mandarin and the London engineers are completely left out.


6) Voice not being heard by upper management. I've raised my concerns but they were all ignored by the managers and all the things mentioned when I signed the contract were false promises.

review_title: To Management: Pride comes before a fall
pros:
WFH
CRO rewards (though we are having a 75% cut thanks to the use of 365VWAP)
cons:
Ask "What to deal with mental issues of employees"
Ans "This is a very competitive industry. We appreciate your effort but you are welcome to join other firms"

Ask "Publicly stated 5% layoff, in fact it more like 40%"
Ans "We should not focus on the number. If you show more ownership to company, we will show more transparency. Since we are private, we have no obligation to share any company's info"

review_title: It's time for Kris "Liar" Marszalek to lose his job
pros: It would have a bright future if the CEO were replaced with a honest and mindful one.
cons:
It's not a matter of lay-off vs retention. Almost every company has been thru laying-off. Rather, it's a matter of integrity, respect, and investor risk control.

It's a huge flag for the CEO to blatantly tell lies! Employees are investors , they trust the company and the C-level executives first, then they invest their precious times and human resources so heavily into the company. However, there was such a sudden unannounced "rug pull" over the last month. 

The CEO should be honest, transparent, and upfront about this. But hey look what he did  instead: he hided critical financial info all the time, and he lied about the magnitude of the lay-off! Even worse, he thought "crypto.com is not a public company, he has the right to withhold info"... But please, i)  CRO (Cronos) is a token that's traded publicly, and ii) private companies  has the obligation to be frank and obligation to disclose material info to its own employees, coz employees are also investors.

If the CEO disrespects employees today, will you believe he will respect investors tomorrow?  Mr. Kris Marszalek's behavior and attitude during the lay-off and town-hall meeting is a clear negative indication (red flag) of the risk of further investing in this company. Investors and stakeholders, please be aware!

----------
Recession is when your coworker loses his job. 
Depression is when you lose yours. 
And recovery is when Kris Marszalek loses his

review_title: Think thrice before going to trading team
pros:
- Good compensation
- Can WFH everyday
- Colleagues are nice and talented
- Good place to start and gain exposure to the crypto industry
cons:
- Refer to other posts about the trading team
- Multiple colleagues have reported poor and alarming physical/mental health issues due to stress
- Trading head lacks management/prioritization ability and doesn't respect other employees
- On the trading dev side, a lot of the system relies on the tech lead, which makes them a potential single point of failure
- Company lacks transparency. CEO will address questions during town hall without really answering the question.
- Multiple colleagues have been fired/laid off on questionable standards 

Think thrice, seriously, or choose a different team if you must.

review_title: Conservative Play in a Dynamic Industry
pros: Allows remote working. Flexible working hours, which sometimes means you have to standby.
cons: Still got the old-fashioned local banking culture, as a lot of people coming from corporate side. They've had the team structure horizontally extended, and adopts the corporate management style, which will work if pitching itself to a finance entity. But in technology or even web3, this cumbersome structure prevents from moving swift. On the other hand, if you follow classic corporate style, then when it comes to things that indeed needs some corporate management expertise, they say "oh we're are start-up we use flattened structure blahblah" to avoid responsibility. People are great talents in each previous field, just overall not innovative-oriented, which I guess matches with company self-defined position? Strategy wise, can't see a clear-defined picture from top management.

pros:
* Good Salary

* Industry recognition.

* Friendly co-workers
cons:
They've laid off hundreds of employees. Though the exact number remains unknown as they intentionally hide the number, we are very certain that it have slashed much more than the previously announced "5% ~ 260 headcounts" 

* Job Insecurity. You've been performing well and all your coworkers recognize & appreciate it. But you may lose your job all of a sudden overnight.

* Opaque. Some people might argue "as long as I get my paychecks month-by-month, I won't care so much about transparent" but hey, you may lose your paycheck due to such opacity 

* Arrogant CEO. He cares about his own success but you (as employees) are doomed to fail


* For most ppl, there is little training. You are expected to learn everything on your own.

* Incompetent HR. They don't even know how to lay off.... Speechless

cons:
The management- it looks like the have 0 understanding of what they are doing. There do not provide updates on time, come up with some bizarre ideas (that in a few weeks time, get replaced again). You need to buy everything on your own if you would like to work here.

They provided only a 13” laptop. The monitor, keyboard, mouse, chairs, desks it is all on you. 

The yearly bonus is in CRO and when I signed my contract the agreed term was agreed to be double the amount that I actually received. I am very disappointed about that.

cons: There are no senior QA openings. Hard to get a promotion. Even if you are an experienced QA (5+years), you still get the same title as those who only have 1-2 years of experience. Sometimes feel frustrated that even if you are experienced, and perform well, you still don't have the chance to be promoted. You will lose motivation.

pros: - fully wfh (actually not ideal if you are a lead) - fully casual - some people are friendly - limited free beverage at the office - company sponsor work machine * 1
cons: - unreasonable and massive layoffs of almost half the workforce, entirely unrelated to performance - excessive number of SVPs, even in back offices - incompetency in solving critical issues - lack of risk management - lack of corporate governance - great people that was not affected by layoffs are leaving

pros: - Flexible working environment - Provides good resources - Invests in its people and there development - alot of interesting projects to work with - Great people
cons: None Still a developing company, so still in the phase of building all the process, structures and frameworks. However on flip side offers great opportunity to build/create and learn new things as well.

review_title: Talented team, good technology practices, complete autonomy

cons: Difficult to get feedback on a short scale basis, minimal engagement with management.

pros: Great projects and leaders Great pay and perks
cons: no real cons just the uncertainty of Crypto

pros: Nothing at all really, see Cons
cons:
-In this job all you have to do is blindly follow stupid processes. If you have an ounce of intelligence it is really insulting.
-Questions are met with dumb answers, the more experienced agents tend to be arrogant and point out every little mistake you make : follow the processes, they say, basically you need to be like a trained monkey.
-The CEO is a liar
-Management clearly doesn't care about employees
-I was fired for economical reasons in just under 20 minutes. When the layoffs started in June, the CEO lied about the numbers and fired way more people. No one knew who'd be next, everyday I'd see less and less colleagues, until they eventually fired me like a dog.

pros:
* Salary & benefits were good
* Plenty of autonomy
* Was fully remote
cons:
* Laid off during probation (part of over 1000 employee layoff). Not nice if you left a company for crypto.com only to be let go during probation.

* Had been specifically told by leadership that layoffs had been completed and that my team would not be impacted. 3 weeks later over 1000 employees were let go in a single day.

* Most of my colleagues had left their previous company to pursue opportunity with crypto.com only to be laid off in their first few weeks - only 1 month salary as compensation.

* Absolutely no interaction with any of the business leaders or announcement. Just told by HR and then accounts locked.

pros: Alot of benefits working at this company
cons: Sometimes you will get tired due to extra workload

review_title: Lack of Transparency and Job Stability
pros: Team members are supportive and helpful. Benefits are good. Interesting work.
cons: The company is hiding the fact that they’ve laid off more than 1,000 employees even though they officially announced laying off 260. They’ve removed the company directory so we can’t see the numbers go down. Management has been silent about the issue and everyone is terrified that their job will be next. It’s not good for morale to see that 1/3 of the invitation list on your next meeting is disabled accounts.

review_title: Bad strategy and  lack of employee respect
pros: Good benefits but mediocre salary. Interesting industry specific business.
cons: Employees are treated as disposable resource. There is no growth opportunity in most departments, no internal mobility, no transparency and fake corporate culture.

pros: Great coworkers and great working atmosphere. People are generally helpful and friendly as long as you are doing what is expected of you.

review_title: Always hiring is not always a good sign

cons: Not really what i signed up for, a bit mislead about the nature of the job and job title during the interview so excellent people are forced to do mediocre work. No appreciation on effort put in by the team. People just leave and go back to the finance industry.

review_title: Good Colleagues and nice working environment
pros:
- Nice working environment. The company is quite flexible under the quarantine situation. I have been working from home for almost 5 months. 
- The team is growing constantly. 
- Flexible working hours as long as you meet the deadline
- The management level always reports back to us about the company situation, which is really nice.
- Quite a lot of annual leave. I got twenty something days of annual leave in my first year, which i don't think i can use it all up.
cons:
- The toilet is small, so sometimes you might have to go other floors.
- The bonus is distributed in CRO or MCO. So if you are not into crypto, you might not like it.

review_title: Think Twice before go to the trading team
pros: The members are very young, It's easy to get along with between teams, some teams are very relaxed, they play games together after work, some persons are pure technical men, It's Great.
cons: The atmosphere of the trading team is  harsh, there is no room for improvement, it is unlimited pressure. The head's ability is average but with a bad temper,  The team never more than 7 members, but leave 7 persons less than a year. It's hard to learning anything inside the team, Because the head  is afraid that you know too much, and in so small a team he also separate each other, you even don’t know what other members are doing.

review_title: Good place to learn something NEW!
pros:
The company is ever fast growing and is very aggressive on being the top companies in Fintech industry. Therefore, everything I have been experiencing is quite new, which requires you to proactively learn new stuff.

As someone who would like to learn more cutting edge things, this is the right place.
cons:
You need to expect a startup company like Crypto.com will not have everything organised. However, people here all work their best to make the company better.

Projects sometimes have a very tight schedule and you have to work really hard to finish the work.

-You must be able to grasp new knowledge and adapt to change very well in order to be able to be effective working here.
